main event: On August 6, 1964, a resident near Moses Lake, Washington, reported sighting an unidentified flying object that was circular in shape, approximately 40-45 feet in diameter, and hovered silently before departing at a high rate of speed.
interesting points: The object was first observed at approximately 2000 feet altitude and hovered for 3-4 minutes before ascending rapidly., The flying object was tracked both visually and by radar at Larson AFB., Ground observers in the Moses Lake area also reported sightings of the object., The object appeared to move in an erratic pattern, described as up, down, and sideways by some witnesses., J. Allen Hynek concluded the incident could be a mistaken identity involving a weather balloon, although the case remains classified as 'unidentified'.
witness description: Mrs. Robert Taber observed a round, silver object approximately 40 feet in diameter.
